oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fourth and First National Bank, Nashville Trust Company, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1928
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Fourth and First National Bank, Nashville Trust Company, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1928. The verso of the postcard quotes "over sixty million dollars" in "resources." This bank was located in downtown Nashville, Tennessee at the corner of Fourth Avenue North and Union Streets. It was just across the street from the banking and brokerage house of Caldwell & Co. The president of the Fourth & First National Bank was James E. Caldwell. The structure was designed by architects Ludlow & Peabody Co. and Foster & Creighton were the general contractors. Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fourth and First National Bank (Nashville, Tenn.)
